title: Introduction to dfsummary
text: Creating descriptive summaries variables data.frames common task. context summarizing patient characteristics population, individual level data often person-sensitive proper precautions made sure summarized data can used identify data individuals. main aim dfsummary provide functions summarizing data automatically mask descriptive summary statistics deemed person-sensitive. secondary aim dfsummary keep things simple: package depends data.table (depends R ) summarized data returned data.frame.

title: Introduction to dfsummary
text: illustrate package works, use simple simulated dataset imitating population information exposure variable, different types patient characteristics. Now lets summarize data using tbl_summary function package. design, summarized data long format. user make aggregated data look presentable. Lets start restructuring data wider format, column exposure level.
code: set.seed(1) n <- 20 pop <-data.frame(   exposure = sample(c("no", "yes"), n, replace = TRUE),   cat_var = sample(c("A", "B", "C"), n, replace = TRUE),   bin_var = sample(c(0, 1), n, replace = TRUE),   cont_var = rnorm(n) )  pop #>    exposure cat_var bin_var    cont_var #> 1        no       A       0 -0.10278773 #> 2       yes       C       1  0.38767161 #> 3        no       A       1 -0.05380504 #> 4        no       A       1 -1.37705956 #> 5       yes       A       1 -0.41499456 #> 6        no       A       1 -0.39428995 #> 7        no       B       0 -0.05931340 #> 8        no       A       0  1.10002537 #> 9       yes       A       1  0.76317575 #> 10      yes       B       0 -0.16452360 #> 11       no       B       1 -0.25336168 #> 12       no       B       1  0.69696338 #> 13       no       A       0  0.55666320 #> 14       no       C       0 -0.68875569 #> 15       no       A       1 -0.70749516 #> 16      yes       C       1  0.36458196 #> 17      yes       B       1  0.76853292 #> 18      yes       B       0 -0.11234621 #> 19      yes       B       0  0.88110773 #> 20       no       B       1  0.39810588 summarized_pop <- tbl_summary(   x = pop,   vars = c("cat_var", "bin_var", "cont_var"),   by = "exposure" )  summarized_pop #>      .by .var_name .var_type .var_level    .stat_label     .stat_value #>  1: .all        .n         n                         n              20 #>  2: .all   bin_var       bin                     n_pct      12 (60.0%) #>  3: .all   cat_var       cat          A          n_pct       9 (45.0%) #>  4: .all   cat_var       cat          B          n_pct       8 (40.0%) #>  5: .all   cat_var       cat          C          n_pct       3 (15.0%) #>  6: .all  cont_var      cont            median_p25_p75  0.1 (-0.3;0.6) #>  7:   no        .n         n                         n              12 #>  8:   no   bin_var       bin                     n_pct       7 (58.3%) #>  9:   no   cat_var       cat          A          n_pct       7 (58.3%) #> 10:   no   cat_var       cat          B          n_pct       4 (33.3%) #> 11:   no   cat_var       cat          C          n_pct        1 (8.3%) #> 12:   no  cont_var      cont            median_p25_p75 -0.1 (-0.5;0.4) #> 13:  yes        .n         n                         n               8 #> 14:  yes   bin_var       bin                     n_pct       5 (62.5%) #> 15:  yes   cat_var       cat          A          n_pct       2 (25.0%) #> 16:  yes   cat_var       cat          B          n_pct       4 (50.0%) #> 17:  yes   cat_var       cat          C          n_pct       2 (25.0%) #> 18:  yes  cont_var      cont            median_p25_p75  0.3 (-0.1;0.7) wide_dat <- dcast(   summarized_pop,   .var_name + .var_level ~ .by,   value.var = ".stat_value" )  wide_dat #>    .var_name .var_level           .all              no            yes #> 1:        .n                        20              12              8 #> 2:   bin_var                12 (60.0%)       7 (58.3%)      5 (62.5%) #> 3:   cat_var          A      9 (45.0%)       7 (58.3%)      2 (25.0%) #> 4:   cat_var          B      8 (40.0%)       4 (33.3%)      4 (50.0%) #> 5:   cat_var          C      3 (15.0%)        1 (8.3%)      2 (25.0%) #> 6:  cont_var            0.1 (-0.3;0.6) -0.1 (-0.5;0.4) 0.3 (-0.1;0.7)

title: Introduction to dfsummary
text: can see summarized data contains aggregated counts larger zero smaller five; values often considered person-sensitive. Person-sensitive counts can automatically masked using mask argument. can see quite lot beene masked. ? See “masking” vignette information?
code: pop |>   tbl_summary(     vars = c("cat_var", "bin_var", "cont_var"),     by = "exposure",     mask = TRUE   ) |>   dcast(     .var_name + .var_level ~ .by,     value.var = ".stat_value"   )  #>    .var_name .var_level           .all              no            yes #> 1:        .n                        20              12              8 #> 2:   bin_var                12 (60.0%)       7 (58.3%)      5 (62.5%) #> 3:   cat_var          A      9 (45.0%)               *              * #> 4:   cat_var          B              *               *              * #> 5:   cat_var          C              *               *              * #> 6:  cont_var            0.1 (-0.3;0.6) -0.1 (-0.5;0.4) 0.3 (-0.1;0.7)

code: @Manual{,   title = {dfsummary: Create Descriptive Summaries of Datasets},   author = {Thomas {Bøjer Rasmussen}},   year = {2023},   note = {R package version 0.0.0.9000, https://thomas-rasmussen.github.io/dfsummary/},   url = {https://github.com/thomas-rasmussen/dfsummary}, }

title: Create Descriptive Summaries of Datasets
text: goal dfsummary make descriptive summries datasets, person-sensitive information automatically masked. contrast packages, eg excellent gtsummary package, package aim provide presentation-ready tables, instead focuses keeping things simple relying data.table package efficient summarization. summarized data returned simple data.table user can finalize table using eg gt flextable package.

title: Summarize a variable — .summarize_var
text: Creates descriptive summary variable data.frame.

title: Summarize a variable — .summarize_var
code: .summarize_var(   x,   var,   type = NULL,   weight = NULL,   by = NULL,   by_total_val = ".all" )

title: Summarize a variable — .summarize_var
text: x Input data.frame. var String. Name variable x summarize. type String. Variable type var: "bin" (binary), "cont" (continuous), "cat" (categorical). Default NULL, meaning type automatically deduced data. See details information. weight String. Name variable x contains observation weights. Must numeric variable, non-negative real values. default (weight = NULL), weights set one. String. Name variable group summarizing. Default NULL, ie grouping variable used. Note grouping variable used, returned data.table still contain "." variable, taking value given by_total_val by_total_val String. Name given overall -group.

title: Summarize a variable — .summarize_var
text: data.table containing descriptive summary var. data.table contains following variables: Group information: ".var_name": Variable name. ".var_type": Variable type. ".": -group value. Summary statistics: ".n_by_level": Number observations "." group. ".var_level": Variable level. used categorical variables. ".n_var_level": Number observations ".var_level" group. ".sum": Sum variable group. binary categorical variables .n_var_level = .sum. .stddev: Standard deviation group. NA binary categorical variables. ".p25": 25th percentile. ".p50": 50th percentile / median. ".p75": 75th percentile.

title: Summarize a variable — .summarize_var
text: type NULL, variable type var deduced data: variable takes "binary" values, ie logical vector, numeric vector zero one's, type set "bin". Else, variable numeric type set "cont". Else, type set "cat".

title: Weighted arithmetic mean — .wmean
text: Calculates weighted arithmetic mean numeric/logical vector x associated weights w.

title: Weighted arithmetic mean — .wmean
text: x numeric logical vector. w numeric vector non-negative numbers. Weights associated x. na.rm logical value. missing values (including NaN) x removed?

title: Weighted arithmetic mean — .wmean

title: Weighted quantile — .wquantile
text: Estimates quantiles using weighted Harrell-Davis quantile estimator.

title: Weighted quantile — .wquantile
code: .wquantile(x, w = rep(1L, length(x)), prob, na.rm = FALSE)

title: Weighted quantile — .wquantile
text: x numeric logical vector. w numeric vector non-negative numbers. Weights associated x. prob Numeric vector probabilities values [0;1] corresponding quantiles estimate. na.rm logical value. missing values (including NaN) x removed?

title: Weighted quantile — .wquantile
text: numeric vector.

title: Weighted quantile — .wquantile
text: Implemented based https://arxiv.org/pdf/2304.07265.pdf.

title: Weighted quantile — .wquantile
code: if (FALSE) {   x <- 1:5   w <- c(1, 0, 1, 0, 1)   .wquantile(x, w, prob = 0.5) }

text: Calculates weighted standard deviation(sd) vector x associated weights w.

title: Weighted standard deviation — .wsd
text: x numeric logical vector. w numeric vector non-negative numbers. Weights associated x. na.rm logical value. missing values (including NaN) x removed?

title: Weighted standard deviation — .wsd
text: numeric value.

title: Mask person-sensitive counts — mask_tbl
text: Masks person-sensitive counts 'tblsummary', precisely, adds variable input table, can used masking.

title: Mask person-sensitive counts — mask_tbl
text: x data.table.

title: Mask person-sensitive counts — mask_tbl
text: data.table

title: Mask person-sensitive counts — mask_tbl
code: if (FALSE) {   x <- data.frame(     var = c("A", "B", "B", rep("C", 5L))   )   tbl1 <- summarize_df(x, var = "var")   tbl2 <- mask_tbl(tbl1) }

what: Summarize variables in a data.frame — summarize_df
title: Summarize variables in a data.frame — summarize_df
text: Returns descriptive summary variables data.frame.

title: Summarize variables in a data.frame — summarize_df
code: summarize_df(x, vars, weight = NULL, by = NULL, by_total_val = ".all")

title: Summarize variables in a data.frame — summarize_df
text: x Input data.frame. vars Character vector. Names variables x summarize. Variables types can specified naming elements var. Variable types : "bin" (binary), "cont" (continuous), "cat" (categorical). variable type specified, type automatically deduced data. weight String. Name variable x contains observation weights. Must numeric variable, non-negative real values. default (weight = NULL), weights set one. String. Name variable group summarizing. Default NULL, ie grouping variable used. Note grouping variable used, returned data.table still contain "." variable, taking value given by_total_val by_total_val String. Name given overall -group.

title: Summarize variables in a data.frame — summarize_df
text: data.table containing descriptive summary vars. data.table contains following variables: Group information: ".var_name": Variable name. ".var_type": Variable type. ".": -group value. Summary statistics: ".n_by_level": Number observations "." group. ".var_level": Variable level. Missing continuous variables. ".n_var_level": Number observations ".var_level" group. ".sum": Sum variable group. binary categorical variables .n_var_level = .sum. .stddev: Standard deviation group. NA binary categorical variables. ".p25": 25th percentile. ".p50": 50th percentile / median. ".p75": 75th percentile.

title: Summarize variables in a data.frame — summarize_df
code: if (FALSE) {   x <- data.frame(var1 = 1:10, var2 = c(rep("A", 5), rep("B", 5)))   summarize_df(    x,    vars = c(cont = "var1", "var2")   ) }

title: Make descriptive summary — tbl_summary
text: Makes descriptive summary distribution variables given data.frame.

title: Make descriptive summary — tbl_summary
code: tbl_summary(   x,   vars,   weight = NULL,   by = NULL,   by_total_val = ".all",   mask = FALSE,   add_num_stat = FALSE )

title: Make descriptive summary — tbl_summary
text: x data.frame. Data summarize. vars Character vector. Names variables x summarize. Variables types can specified naming elements var. Variable types : "bin" (binary), "cont" (continuous), "cat" (categorical). variable type specified, type automatically deduced data. See details information. weight String. Name variable x contains observation weights. Must numeric variable, non-negative real values. default (weight = NULL), weights set one. String. Name variable group summarizing. Default NULL, ie grouping variable used. Note grouping variable used, returned data.table still contain "." variable, taking value given by_total_val. by_total_val String. Name given overall -group. mask logical value. Mask person-sensitive aggregated counts? add_num_stat logical value. Add numeric columns statistics?

title: Make descriptive summary — tbl_summary
text: data.table containing descriptive summary vars. data.table contains following variables: ".": -group value. ".var_name": Variable name. ".var_type": Variable type. ".var_level": Variable level. used categorical variables. ".stat_label": Short-name calculated statistics. ".stat_value": Statistics value.

title: Make descriptive summary — tbl_summary
text: type variable vars specified, type deduced data using following algorithm: variable takes "binary" values, ie logical vector, numeric vector zero one's, variable assumed binary variable. Else, variable numeric assumed continuous variable. Else, variable assumed categorical variable.

title: Make descriptive summary — tbl_summary
code: x <- data.frame(   var_cont = 1:10,   var_bin = c(rep(1, 5), rep(0, 5)),   var_cat = c(rep(1, 5), rep(2, 5)) )  dt <- tbl_summary(   x = x,   vars = c("var_cont", "var_bin", cat = "var_cat"), )
